result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karl R. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CM728, 22CM798, 22CM867, 22CM887, 22CF1180 are called at 11:34 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Karl Johnson appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Law Intern David Carlson supervised by Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CM867, 22CM887, 22CF1180. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived in 22CF1180. 
Settlement Conference on all cases (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/21/2022 at 1:45 PM. 
Hearing on all cases: 12/05/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Non-party received via mail, no indication on copies to other parties.
Letter from L.L. and L.J. regarding brother (defendant), dated 09/20/2022.

Conditions:
No contact with Sojourner House
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety
(Covers 22CM728 & 22CM798)

Waives reading of the complaint in both files and bond is set. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/03/22 at 2:45pm
